definition: mark/sign/label/to mark with a symbol, label, lettering etc/to bear (a brand name, registration number etc)/prize/award/bid/target/quota/(old) the topmost branches of a tree/visible symptom/classifier for military units
notice or announcement/list of names/public roll of successful examinees

sentences.english: The newest high-end apartments on Mars are being marketed with a headphone closet.
sentences.chinese: 最新的火星高級公寓都要標榜自己有一個耳機櫃。

sentences.english: So, Alexander is putting himself forward as divine.
sentences.chinese: 所以亞歷山大標榜自己爲神。

sentences.english: He even identified himself, because he started claiming divine status for himself.
sentences.chinese: 他甚至標榜自己，自稱爲神。

sentences.english: Nutra prides itself on its ability to meet consumer expectations and satisfy product demand.
sentences.chinese: 保健品標榜它能夠滿足消費者的期望和滿足產品需求。

sentences.english: Pullover tunic flaunts a point collar and open half placket.
sentences.chinese: 套衫中山裝標榜點衣領和開半門襟。

sentences.english: Africom innocuously brands itself as "advising and training" military forces.
sentences.chinese: 非洲司令部無害地標榜自己爲“資訊和培訓”的軍隊。

sentences.english: Mary was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗老是標榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典範。

sentences.english: YUAN Zhen gave definition of erotic poetry.
sentences.chinese: 元稹自敘“豔詩”定義，以“幹教化”相標榜。

sentences.english: She was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 瑪麗老是標榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典範。

sentences.english: And yet, we are also labelled a bad food nation.
sentences.chinese: 儘管如此，我們還被標榜爲名不副實的飲食之國。

sentences.english: She was always holding up her children as paragons of good behaviour.
sentences.chinese: 她總是標榜自己的孩子是品行端正的典範。

sentences.english: Gorgeous empire gown flaunts a wrap - style bodice and drawstring tie.
sentences.chinese: 華麗的禮服帝國標榜一包式胸衣和束帶配合。

sentences.english: But on a resume, it's okay to brag.
sentences.chinese: 但是在簡歷裏面，自我標榜是可以接受的。

sentences.english: At a time when the nation is obsessed with sloganeering about honesty … dishonesty is still a plague.
sentences.chinese: 在全國都在標榜誠信的時候，不誠信仍然比比皆是。

sentences.english: The matching set of pierced earrings also flaunt 2 brilliant-cut clear crystals.
sentences.chinese: 匹配的一套穿耳環也標榜二輝煌的切明確的晶體。

sentences.english: Self-praise is felt to be ill-bred.
sentences.chinese: 自我標榜會被認爲沒有教養。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to own exclusively/unique to/specific/there is only
not only (this one)/not just (...) but also
to proclaim/to make public or well known
